nbsRoadmMib.name: nbsRoadmMib
nbsRoadmMib.contactinfo: For technical support, please contact your service channel

nbsRoadmFlexgridGrp.name: nbsRoadmFlexgridGrp
nbsRoadmFlexgridGrp.description: Describes Flexgrid centerline and bandwidth capabilities

nbsRoadmStagingGrp.name: nbsRoadmStagingGrp
nbsRoadmStagingGrp.description: Scratchpad for users to configure channels and WSS setup

nbsRoadmCommittedGrp.name: nbsRoadmCommittedGrp
nbsRoadmCommittedGrp.description: Administratively active channel and WSS setup.

nbsRoadmCommonTableSize.name: nbsRoadmCommonTableSize
nbsRoadmCommonTableSize.description: The number of entries in nbsRoadmCommonTable

nbsRoadmCommonIfIndex.name: nbsRoadmCommonIfIndex
nbsRoadmCommonIfIndex.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of this channel's trunk port.

nbsRoadmCommonStagingQuickCfg.name: nbsRoadmCommonStagingQuickCfg
nbsRoadmCommonStagingQuickCfg.description: Impulse object used to replace this port's current nbsRoadmStagingTable entries with a known configuration. Users may create the nbsRoadmStagingTable manually, a row at a time. Often it would save the users much work if they could initially populate this table with a standard or known configuration and then customize it to their own requirements. When read, this object will indicate whether this feature is available by reporting either notSupported(1) or supported(2). The value std100Ghz(3) overwrites this port's nbsRoadmStagingTable with all the standard 100 GHz ITU grid channels which are supported by this port. The value std50Ghz(4) overwrites this port's nbsRoadmStagingTable with all the standard 50 GHz ITU grid channels which are supported by this port. Overwriting the nbsRoadmStagingTable entries has no effect on the live configuration until committed using nbsRoadmCommonStagingCommit

nbsRoadmCommonStagingAddCaps.name: nbsRoadmCommonStagingAddCaps
nbsRoadmCommonStagingAddCaps.description: This object indicates if this port is capable of Add

nbsRoadmCommonStagingDropCaps.name: nbsRoadmCommonStagingDropCaps
nbsRoadmCommonStagingDropCaps.description: This object indicates if this port is capable of Drop

nbsRoadmCommonStagingCommit.name: nbsRoadmCommonStagingCommit
nbsRoadmCommonStagingCommit.description: Impulse object used to rewrite the entire WSS configuration. In order to protect users against accidentally dropping traffic streams, a two-step process is used. In the first step, users 'stage' a WSS configuration. The nbsRoadmStagingTable is like a scratchpad where users can build and modify the entire WSS configuration without affecting the live network. Here users assign channels to WSS ports, and for flex-grids, define the channels. The second step is to replace the existing WSS configuration (which can be read from the nbsRoadmCommittedTable). To replace the existing setup with the configuration specified in the nbsRoadmStagingTable, users set this object to apply(4). To discard all changes done to nbsRoadmStagingTable, users set this object to revertToCommitted(3), which will synchronize the Staging table to the Staged configuation. When read, this object will report the action last requested until that action is completed, after which it will report supported(2).

nbsRoadmCommonCommittedGridType.name: nbsRoadmCommonCommittedGridType
nbsRoadmCommonCommittedGridType.description: This object is automatically updated in association with writes to nbsRoadmCommonStagingApply. It indicates whether or not this port's updated nbsRoadmCommittedTable is equivalent to a standard ITU grid such as would come from nbsRoadmCommonStagingQuickCfg. If the nbsRoadmCommittedTable matches the results from a nbsRoadmCommonStagingQuickCfg of std100Ghz(4), then this object will report std100Ghz(4). If the nbsRoadmCommittedTable matches the results from a nbsRoadmCommonStagingQuickCfg of std50Ghz(5), then this object will report std50Ghz(5). If the nbsRoadmCommittedTable matches neither the results from a nbsRoadmCommonStagingQuickCfg of std100Ghz(4) or std50Ghz(5), then this object will report customized(3).

nbsRoadmCommonCommittedChannels.name: nbsRoadmCommonCommittedChannels
nbsRoadmCommonCommittedChannels.description: The number of channels for this wdm port in the nbsRoadmCommittedTable.

nbsRoadmFlexgridTableSize.name: nbsRoadmFlexgridTableSize
nbsRoadmFlexgridTableSize.description: The number of entries in nbsRoadmFlexgridTable.

nbsRoadmFlexgridIfIndex.name: nbsRoadmFlexgridIfIndex
nbsRoadmFlexgridIfIndex.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of the Common port.

nbsRoadmFlexgridCenterlineMin.name: nbsRoadmFlexgridCenterlineMin
nbsRoadmFlexgridCenterlineMin.description: The frequency of the lowest centerline possible.

nbsRoadmFlexgridCenterlineMax.name: nbsRoadmFlexgridCenterlineMax
nbsRoadmFlexgridCenterlineMax.description: The frequency of the highest centerline possible.

nbsRoadmFlexgridCenterlineIncr.name: nbsRoadmFlexgridCenterlineIncr
nbsRoadmFlexgridCenterlineIncr.description: Centerline increment - the minimum possible difference, in MHz, between adjacent channels' centerlines.

nbsRoadmFlexgridBandwidthMin.name: nbsRoadmFlexgridBandwidthMin
nbsRoadmFlexgridBandwidthMin.description: The minimum bandwidth possible. Each channel must be at least this wide.

nbsRoadmFlexgridBandwidthMax.name: nbsRoadmFlexgridBandwidthMax
nbsRoadmFlexgridBandwidthMax.description: The maximum bandwidth possible. Each channel must be at most this wide.

nbsRoadmFlexgridBandwidthIncr.name: nbsRoadmFlexgridBandwidthIncr
nbsRoadmFlexgridBandwidthIncr.description: The granularity of bandwidths possible. Each channel's bandwidth must be a multiple of this number.

nbsRoadmStagingTableSize.name: nbsRoadmStagingTableSize
nbsRoadmStagingTableSize.description: The number of entries in nbsRoadmStagingTable

nbsRoadmStagingTable.name: nbsRoadmStagingTable
nbsRoadmStagingTable.description: Scratchpad where users can specify a new WSS configuration. Changes to this table have no effect on the system until they are committed using nbsRoadmCommonStagingApply.

nbsRoadmStagingIfIndex.name: nbsRoadmStagingIfIndex
nbsRoadmStagingIfIndex.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of this channel's Common port.

nbsRoadmStagingCenterline.name: nbsRoadmStagingCenterline
nbsRoadmStagingCenterline.description: The center frequency of this channel, in MHz

nbsRoadmStagingBandwidth.name: nbsRoadmStagingBandwidth
nbsRoadmStagingBandwidth.description: The amount of spectrum allocated for this channel, in MHz

nbsRoadmStagingChannelName.name: nbsRoadmStagingChannelName
nbsRoadmStagingChannelName.description: User-assigned name for this channel. The assigned name must be unique within this agent system.

nbsRoadmStagingAddPort.name: nbsRoadmStagingAddPort
nbsRoadmStagingAddPort.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of this channel's Add port. This channel will be blocked from all Add ports except the port specified here. Setting this object to 0 blocks the channel on all Add ports. Not supported value : -1

nbsRoadmStagingDropPort.name: nbsRoadmStagingDropPort
nbsRoadmStagingDropPort.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of this channel's Drop port. This channel will be blocked on all Drop ports except the port specified here. Setting this object to 0 blocks the channel on all Drop ports. Not supported value : -1

nbsRoadmStagingSecondaryPort.name: nbsRoadmStagingSecondaryPort
nbsRoadmStagingSecondaryPort.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of this channel's Secondary port. This channel will be blocked from all Add ports except the port specified here. Setting this object to 0 removes the secondary.

nbsRoadmStagingSecondAttenu.name: nbsRoadmStagingSecondAttenu
nbsRoadmStagingSecondAttenu.description: Attenuation actually being applied to the secondary port, in millidecibels (mdB).

nbsRoadmStagingAddAttenu.name: nbsRoadmStagingAddAttenu
nbsRoadmStagingAddAttenu.description: Attenuation to be applied to Add channel, expressed in millidecibels (mdB). Default is the blocked value as defined in NbsTcMilliDb

nbsRoadmStagingDropAttenu.name: nbsRoadmStagingDropAttenu
nbsRoadmStagingDropAttenu.description: Attenuation to be applied to Drop channel, expressed in millidecibels (mdB). Default is the blocked value as defined in NbsTcMilliDb

nbsRoadmStagingItuName.name: nbsRoadmStagingItuName
nbsRoadmStagingItuName.description: If this channel's centerline and bandwidth match a channel specified in the ITU grid DWDM standard, the name of that ITU channel will be shown here. The naming convention for 100GHz channels will be the two digit ITU channel number. For 50GHz channels, the convention will be to specify either the C or H band, followed by the two digit ITU channel number. For user-defined channels that don't match an ITU channel, this object will report 'N/A'.

nbsRoadmStagingRowStatus.name: nbsRoadmStagingRowStatus
nbsRoadmStagingRowStatus.description: Used to create and delete channels in staging area

nbsRoadmCommittedTableSize.name: nbsRoadmCommittedTableSize
nbsRoadmCommittedTableSize.description: The number of entries in nbsRoadmCommittedTable

nbsRoadmCommittedIfIndex.name: nbsRoadmCommittedIfIndex
nbsRoadmCommittedIfIndex.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of the channel's Common port.

nbsRoadmCommittedCenterline.name: nbsRoadmCommittedCenterline
nbsRoadmCommittedCenterline.description: The center frequency of this channel, in MHz

nbsRoadmCommittedBandwidth.name: nbsRoadmCommittedBandwidth
nbsRoadmCommittedBandwidth.description: The amount of spectrum allocated for this channel, in MHz

nbsRoadmCommittedChannelName.name: nbsRoadmCommittedChannelName
nbsRoadmCommittedChannelName.description: User-assigned name for this channel. The assigned name must be unique within this agent system. This object is equivalent to nbsWdmChannelCustomName.

nbsRoadmCommittedAddPort.name: nbsRoadmCommittedAddPort
nbsRoadmCommittedAddPort.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of this channel's Add port. This channel will be blocked from all Add ports except the port specified here. Setting this object to 0 blocks the channel on all ports. Not supported value : -1

nbsRoadmCommittedDropPort.name: nbsRoadmCommittedDropPort
nbsRoadmCommittedDropPort.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of this channel's Drop port. This channel will be blocked on all Drop ports except the port specified here. Setting this object to 0 blocks the channel on all ports. Not supported value : -1

nbsRoadmCommittedSecondaryPort.name: nbsRoadmCommittedSecondaryPort
nbsRoadmCommittedSecondaryPort.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of this channel's Secondary Add port. This channel will be blocked from all Add ports except the port specified here. Setting this object to 0 removes the secondary.

nbsRoadmCommittedSecondAttenu.name: nbsRoadmCommittedSecondAttenu
nbsRoadmCommittedSecondAttenu.description: Attenuation actually being applied to the secondary port, in millidecibels (mdB).

nbsRoadmCommittedAddAttenu.name: nbsRoadmCommittedAddAttenu
nbsRoadmCommittedAddAttenu.description: Attenuation actually being applied to Add channel, in millidecibels (mdB).

nbsRoadmCommittedDropAttenu.name: nbsRoadmCommittedDropAttenu
nbsRoadmCommittedDropAttenu.description: Attenuation actually being applied to Drop channel, in millidecibels (mdB).

nbsRoadmCommittedItuName.name: nbsRoadmCommittedItuName
nbsRoadmCommittedItuName.description: If this channel's centerline and bandwidth match a channel specified in the ITU grid DWDM standard, the name of that ITU channel will be shown here. The naming convention for 100GHz channels will be the two digit ITU channel number. For 50GHz channels, the convention will be to specify either the C or H band, followed by the two digit ITU channel number. For user-defined channels that don't match an ITU channel, this object will report 'N/A'.

nbsRoadmRedundantTableSize.name: nbsRoadmRedundantTableSize
nbsRoadmRedundantTableSize.description: The number of entries in nbsRoadmRedundantTable

nbsRoadmRedundantIfIndex.name: nbsRoadmRedundantIfIndex
nbsRoadmRedundantIfIndex.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of the channel's Common port.

nbsRoadmRedundantCenterline.name: nbsRoadmRedundantCenterline
nbsRoadmRedundantCenterline.description: The center frequency of this channel, in MHz

nbsRoadmRedundantItuName.name: nbsRoadmRedundantItuName
nbsRoadmRedundantItuName.description: If this channel's centerline and bandwidth match a channel specified in the ITU grid DWDM standard, the name of that ITU channel will be shown here. The naming convention for 100GHz channels will be the two digit ITU channel number. For 50GHz channels, the convention will be to specify either the C or H band, followed by the two digit ITU channel number. For user-defined channels that don't match an ITU channel, this object will report 'N/A'.

nbsRoadmRedundantChannelName.name: nbsRoadmRedundantChannelName
nbsRoadmRedundantChannelName.description: User-assigned name for this channel. The assigned name must be unique within this agent system. This object is equivalent to nbsWdmChannelCustomName.

nbsRoadmRedundantMapPort.name: nbsRoadmRedundantMapPort
nbsRoadmRedundantMapPort.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of the current channel's map port.

nbsRoadmRedundantSecondaryPort.name: nbsRoadmRedundantSecondaryPort
nbsRoadmRedundantSecondaryPort.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of the current channel's Secondary port.

nbsRoadmRedundantCurPort.name: nbsRoadmRedundantCurPort
nbsRoadmRedundantCurPort.description: The Mib2 ifIndex of the current channel's Secondary port.

nbsRoadmRedundantCurAttenu.name: nbsRoadmRedundantCurAttenu
nbsRoadmRedundantCurAttenu.description: Attenuation actually being applied to the redundant channel, in millidecibels (mdB).

nbsRoadmRedundantCurState.name: nbsRoadmRedundantCurState
nbsRoadmRedundantCurState.description: The state of the current redundant port.

nbsRoadmEventStageAreaCommitted.name: nbsRoadmEventStageAreaCommitted
nbsRoadmEventStageAreaCommitted.description: Sent after an nbsRoadmCommonStagingCommit request is fulfilled. This Notification is of severity ERROR, which means it should be emitted unless disabled or nbsCmmcSysTrapTblEntLevel is set to a severity worse than error(3).

nbsRoadmEventRedundancyTriggered.name: nbsRoadmEventRedundancyTriggered
nbsRoadmEventRedundancyTriggered.description: Sent after an channel redundancy takes effect. This Notification is of severity ERROR, which means it should be emitted unless disabled or nbsCmmcSysTrapTblEntLevel is set to a severity worse than error(3).
